item.title: Emmy Awards 2021: The Crown and Ted Lasso sweep major categories
item.description: Netflix's royal drama and Apple's comedy series swept the drama and comedy prizes at Sunday's event.

item.title: Emmy Awards 2021: The red carpet looks in pictures
item.description: Kaley Cuoco, Olivia Colman and Gillian Anderson are among the stars attending the ceremony.

item.title: Ted Lasso: What's the big deal about Emmy-winning football comedy?
item.description: The Apple TV comedy series won several major prizes at Sunday night's Emmy awards.

item.title: Emmy Awards 2021: The winners and nominees
item.description: A rundown of the shows and stars competing for the biggest awards in US TV in September.

item.title: Only Fools and Horses actor John Challis dies aged 79
item.description: The actor was best known for playing unscrupulous car dealer Boycie in sitcom Only Fools and Horses.

item.title: Strictly champ Oti Mabuse goes for hat-trick with rugby star Ugo Monye
item.description: Oti Mabuse and Ugo Monye's rivals include the show's first all-male pair - John Whaite and Johannes Radebe.

item.title: BBC 'extremely sorry' over loss of murdered schoolgirl's clothes
item.description: Michelle Hadaway says Martin Bashir asked to get her daughter's clothes DNA tested for a BBC programme.

item.title: Liam Gallagher shares photo after 'helicopter fall'
item.description: The former Oasis frontman shares an image of his bruised face after playing the Isle of Wight Festival.

item.title: Chess icon sues Netflix for Queen's Gambit portrayal
item.description: Nona Gaprindashvili files a defamation lawsuit claiming she was incorrectly portrayed in the series.

item.title: Manic Street Preachers: Welsh rock band beat Steps (again) to top album charts
item.description: Welsh rock group's 14th album, The Ultra Vivid Lament, wins re-run of 90s chart battle with Steps.

item.title: Strictly Come Dancing: 15 things we learned from the stars of 2021
item.description: A round-up of 15 things we learned from this year's Strictly Come Dancing celebrities.

item.title: John Challis and Boycie - how one of TV's greatest comedy characters was born
item.description: The late actor was known for playing Only Fools and Horses' smarmy second-hand car salesman Boycie.

item.title: Lil Nas X: Is the rapper the defining star of his generation?
item.description: The rapper has subverted hip-hop with his LGBT-positive lyrics, while dominating critics on social media.

item.title: Everybody's Talking About Jamie: 'There's more to the UK than London'
item.description: A new film tells the story of a boy who lives on a council estate and is obsessed with drag.

item.title: The unlikely rise of new Culture Secretary Nadine Dorries
item.description: Mistrusted by some in the arts, the new culture secretary is said by a colleague to be "up for the fight".

item.title: The Wanted's Tom Parker: 'I'm not paying attention to cancer'
item.description: "The more you pay attention to it, the more the cancer has control of you," says The Wanted star.

item.title: Oasis Knebworth 1996: 'We had no fear'
item.description: Noel Gallagher on the new film marking 25 years since his old band's era-defining gigs.

item.title: LJ Ross: The self-published crime writer making a killing
item.description: She has sold more than seven million copies of her works since swapping financial law for crime writing.

item.title: Only Fools and Horses' Boycie actor John Challis dies
item.description: John Challis, best known for starring as a second-hand car dealer in the BBC sitcom, has died aged 79.

item.title: Street dreams of Nairobi dance crew hoping to beat the odds
item.description: A group of street dancers in Nairobi, Kenya, struggle against the odds to become celebrities.

item.title: Morgan Bullock makes professional debut in Riverdance
item.description: Morgan Bullock from Richmond, Virginia, joins the UK touring company of the acclaimed Irish dance show.

item.title: Get an Eiffel of this performer walking the line in Paris
item.description: Nathan Paulin walks along a 70m (230ft) high slackline attached to an iconic French landmark.

item.title: Planes turned into graffiti canvasses by street artist
item.description: Street artist Jim Vision had an idea for what to do with planes that have ended their flying days.

item.title: Manchester music cafe brings joy to people with dementia
item.description: People with dementia sing, play instruments and dance at the music cafe, says Manchester Camerata.
